text:
DO YOURSELF A FAVOUR AND DO NOT BOOK HERE. There was NOTHING luxurious about this place. We got to our room and wanted to jump in the pool because it was so hot. The pool was filthy. Not only was it tiny, we couldnt even see the bottom and the water looked like pond water. We asked them to put the filter on and Brown water poured out from it, that smelt like sewerage. We asked them to clean the pool only to be told that the pool man comes every 5 DAYS!  
The rooms were dirty, rips in the sheets, mould on the walls, grime and dirt visible in every direction.  
The stench of moth balls stung our nostrils when we arrived. 
We asked to be changed rooms but to see the room first, it was even worse than the one we were in. 
The sheets on the bed had rips on each corner exposing the blankets. 
The floors looked like they had never been cleaned and the construction site behind us looked directly into our bathroom-privacy lacked immensely. The construction noise started early morning and the sound of power tools were constant till the evening. 
The shower head and taps sprayed water from every direction. The tv chanels didnt work and the tv clarity was non existent-the one chanel that worked you couldnt even watch. 
We opened the fridge only to be mortified by the overwhelming stench of smelling like something had died in it a few days earlier.
Since we booked on booking.com they refused us a refund. We told them we would stay the night and leave the following day only to be out of pocket for our last 3 nights in Bali-it was better than spending anymore time in this hell hole. 
This place was over priced, poorly maintained and lacked cleanliness. 
We will never stay here again! The photos and reviews did not live up to expectation, not even slightly. If we paid $20 dollars a night, this would still be questionable.  I hope this review helps other travellers get a real idea of what this "luxury villa" is really like.
title: WORST PLACE IVE EVER STAYED

Best Regards,

text:
One of the reason why I chose Taman Mesari over the other villa was merely because of the outdoor jacuzzi in the private pool. Little that I know, it was the best decision I ever made. The low density private villa ensures privacy and it was more like your own villa. It was like entering a different world once you are inside with their well manicured garden and fish pond alongside the lobby area. 

All the staff was very accomodating, the hospitality was far beyond my expectation. They were very professional, love their jobs that they were able to go an extra mile to make your stay a memorable one. They know what they were doing and passionate about their job. I hope the management will continue to keep these precious talents that are very hard to get nowadays. Thank you a bunch to Ms. Wisma, Ms. Rima, Mr. Ichan, Mr. Heri and all the other staff that I didn't managed to get their names. 

It was my mom's birthday surprise and the staff was so sporting in helping me to arrange it so well that I forgot that I only make the arrangements week before. I took the decoration package and private dinner at the villa and really satisfied and amazed with the arrangements. Food during the dinner was tasty and appetizing. They also helped me with receiving cakes and special bouquet I ordered to be delivered to the villa on the day I arrived. 

I also asked for their suggestion on photographers which they recommended a very good, young and talented group of photographers and videographer to shoot the moments. We love the photos taken and the video that we can't stop watching over and over again. 

It was a very successful surprise,wonderful holiday and my mom was very happy, her reaction was priceless. All worth it.
title: Birthday Surprise Celebration went Awesome

text:
I gave the facility 5 stars based on the quality of customer service alone. The staff went above and beyond to ensure I had a great holiday. I chose this property due to the amenities for an extended stay. I added the birthday package to my reservation, which was worth every penny. They even provided me with a bouquet of flowers. The check in process was very simple. They were even prepared for my early arrival. The quality of breakfast was great, and very filling. The in villa dinner went above my expectations. They offer a four course dinner. My stay included a free one hour massage, and I regret not setting time aside to schedule. They keep the grounds very clean. Be prepared to see a few small creatures, and be sure to pack mosquito repellent (mosquitos are everywhere in Bali). The pool is of a great size, and I ended it during my stay. The bathroom is massive, and I enjoyed the extra space. Take advantage of the floating breakfast, I felt it was a neat experience. The room looked exactly like the photos posted online. The location is perfect. I walked to the beach twice, 15 minutes to Double Six beach. There's plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby.

Areas of improvement: There were stains on the kitchen floor, maintenance should provide attention here. It didn't bother me, but I would have preferred to not see any stains. The bath towels and hand towels should be replaced. They look very old. I would have like to have wash cloths in the room as well. It would be helpful to have a few more dishes in the room, along with paper towels. There were no paper towels to clean up a spill.

TIP while in Bali: If possible, only use Blue Bird Taxi. They offer the best rates. I learned this quickly on my first night. Be sure to look for the name Blue Bird because there are several blue taxi's in the area.
title: Birthday Holiday!

text:
Villa 4A needs a bit of minor maintenance. i.e Shower head jets are not aligned and the floor gets a wash every time. Bathroom sink tap is loose. The decking and wood work is not stained which makes it look dated and unappealing, i bit of wood stain on all the woodwork would look magic. The vegetation (Vines and Birds of paradise) need triming. The vines make it look untidy and the birds of paradise are well overgrown.

The bed was really comfortable with a good air-conditioning system. The shower had great water pressure and was also a bath, 2 people to fit in there easily. The small kitchenette served its purpose with the fridge being ample to store some fruit and some beverages. There was a water filter there which kept water cold for drinking or boiling if you wanted a cuppa (No Bali Belly from this water - Thank you).

A 5 minute walk had you on the street at Bintang Supermarket - We got most of our supplies from there. Money exchange was also within this area and it was safe and trustworthy (GMC or GBC I think it was called). Exchange rate for AUD averaged at 10500 IDr to $1 which compared to Melbourne Airport was excellent.

On the meter a taxi ride to Seminyak square was approx. 25,000IDR and 30,000 to Kuta.
title: Relaxing time away in older Villa

Our villa was lovely. Starting to age a bit, but nothing to be concerned about. 

Open air living with your bedroom being a secluded little hide away. A pool and spa right at the door of your bedroom. Literally at the door of your bedroom. No steps, just straight from the bedroom door into the deep end. And a couple of strokes to the inbuilt spa. Absolutely wonderful. 

Fresh drinking water supplied, gas cooktop in the open living dinning area. When I say open living. I don’t mean no walls between rooms. I mean no walls at all, your sitting out on a covered garden area. Its just lovely. 

Staff are super friendly and tentative to your every need. Very close to shopping and markets. All in walking distance. Lost of restaurants right around the corner or you can just order in. 

We would return to Taman Mesari without hesitation.

text:
We had the most amazing stay at Taman Mesari! From the minute Ngurah picked us up from the airport to the minute we left Taman Mesari staff were friendly, helpful and couldn't do enough for you! On arrival there was no faffing around with check in he took us straight to our villa and gave us all the info we needed there!

The villa is stunning!!! Meticulously cleaned every day at a time of your choice and they are all very friendly and speak great English!

We had breakfast served for us every morning by Fery who was brilliant, you have a choice of American, continental, Indonesian, pancakes (you have to try these) and cereals all are served with juice tea fresh fruit and toast and cousiants those who thought there isn't enough choice are being unrealistic! 

We had the BBQ on our first night I would recommend it the food was great and created a real feel of Bali!

The villa is nice and privet with high Walls but it's huge high roof creates the feeling of lots of space. The staff never enter uninvited and always seek your permition before entering! 

You also have to have the in villa spa treatments all amazing and so relaxing!! 

All in all taman mesari made our honeymoon the most amazing Balinese experience for us! We plan to return on our 30th wedding anniversary lol!!! 
Thank you to absolutely every one at taman mesari especially Ngurah, Fery, Ichan, Arya!
title: My Second Home

text:
This was a return trip here for us after spending one day at mesari as a trial last year. (And being very impressed)
Airport transfer went smoothly.
On arrival we were told the room I had requested was undergoing maintenance so this was disappointing, after confirming this villa was available. An email to inform of this change would have been nice.
The living area in the villa is all open plan and was nice and roomy for the 4 of us.
The pool is lovely and clean but didn't get a lot of sun.
The rooms are clean but unfortunately this cannot be said for the sheets. They were 'clean' but stained. (Sadly something which is all too common in Bali) and was slightly off putting. As a result we requested the sheets be changed and then not re changed throughout our stay. So after this was done, no complaints with the rooms. (And the sheets they changed were pristine....) 
Villas all cleaned and made up daily with no issues. 
The staff are all so very friendly and welcoming. English as a second language and quite broken so sometimes difficult to communicate but was not a problem for us. 
Had a lovely in villa BBQ cooked for us for something different. Heaps of meat! Probably not worth $35 each but a nice experience.
The villa itself is a short walk (probably 100m down a dark ally at night, but not once did we feel unsafe. 
Short walk to Bintang supermarket. Small scooter ride to seminyak "eat street " and Kuta. Nice walk to beach. 
Overall, despite not being as impressed the first time (however the villa was only 1 month old then!) This was another relaxing girls trip!
title: Return visit

text:
Very nice staff, everybody was always smiling and chatty. The villas are nice and space full with all the amenities you could possibly need. They even provide mosquito repellents which you will definitely need. The villas are located in center of Seminyak with all the clubs and restaurants. It's crowded and loud but you can't hear any noice from the street in your villa.
The villa is beautiful and well designed but unfortunately a bit dirty and not very well maintained. The first day of our arrival we had dirty towels in our room. They've been replaced instantly after our complain yet in my opinion all the towels were a bit old and dirty. The breakfast list is wide and you have what to choose from but I would add more vegetables and a vegetarian option.

text:
Stayed 8 nights with family in 2 bedroom villa. Was impressed with the large space, great size pool and seperate bathrooms for each bedroom. 

Villa was clean and staff very friendly. 

Location was great although agree with other reviews the ally to the property was dirty and dark (rubbish and rodents everywhere). 

Breakfast and BBQ dinner was great.

text:
This was the 3rd pool villa I've stayed at in the area in 2 years. Walked past during last visit and was impressed by friendly staff so decided to book. Found Taman Mesari to be excellent value for a pool villa. Was very impressed upon check in. Great pool with built in jacuzzi - bought my own blow up floating lounge but one was provided (not usual in villas) and bean bag sunlounge to follow the sun on the deck. Great kitchen facilities (full size fridge/freezer- also not standard) and the bonus of filtered hot/cold filtered water and coffee pod machine is excellent if that suits your needs. Huge bathroom/bath/robe area and great sized bedroom with glass doors opening onto pool and private seperate sitting area. Very well appointed with mosquito coils, spray etc. As to be expected in villas in Bali, the open nature leads to 'wildlife' to be present in open areas. This happens in all pool villas I have stayed in Bali (9 in total) and if this isn't desired - book a hotel/resort when you will not have the privacy open area offered by a pool villa. Was disappointed to also read the reviews of the breakfast. I wasn't concerned as I don't come to Bali to eat breakfast and also if I wanted the big commercial breakfast buffet, I would book into a resort in Nusa Dua. The breakfast served was highly adequate: choice of fresh fruits, cereals, 3 trays of hot foods, eggs cooked as requested and a selection of bakery products. Hot drinks also prepared as requested. The service and desire to impress was very good from the breakfast staff and anything requested was quickly sought. It is a villa complex consisting of only 10 villas so not a massive turnover of required foods in comparison to larger resorts.
I did have to call reception once during my stay, the first night, when the pool waterfall was still working at 11pm and was a bit noisy!! Not really a big issue - but staff were at my door within 2 mins to check out problem. He went away and within 5 mins the waterfall was switched off and a follow up phone call was made to check the problem was fixed. Was happy with this service and assistance. Friendly front counter staff to greet and farewell each time you pass through.
I do agree with other reviews regarding the road into villa. Possibly 25m of dark stretch in between main path (walking past large villa complex) and Taman Mesari. All other villa complexes down road past Taman Mesari face the same problem. A phone torch to light the path helped the situation. A small issue outweighed by the close proximity to Jl Legian and located in between Kuta and Seminyak near Double Six road. Check out prices of The Haven and Sun Island villas, The Kasih Villa (further walk up the dark road) to compare private pool villas that are all in close proximity. Well worth paying the bit more in comparison to Jas Boutique Villas (next door) and will definitely rebook for another stay in the future as I come to Bali 1/2 per year. Please remember Bali accommodation is not in comparison to Western facilities/building standards but they try very hard to please and display great design ideas. 
A phone in the sleeping pavilion would've been beneficial so as to avoid running out to make a phone call or if phone rings while inside. 
Overall, I highly recommend Taman Mesari as value, locale and facilities are highlights and will definitely be back.
title: Great pool villa - will definitely return.

text:
I stayed at Taman Mesari for 7 nights in May.   My arrival at the hotel was disappointing as I arrived during a black out.   The hotel was in complete darkness.    I had to scrabble for money to pay the taxi driver in the headlights of the vehicle – I was surprised that the Staff didn’t do much to assist with lamps or torches.  I was not made to feel that welcome – and was told that the black out was due to a fire nearby.   I was taken to my room by torchlight and decided to go out again as I couldn’t see anything at all in the room.   

When I returned later in the evening, the power was back on so I could actually see the Villa.   It certainly was a lovely Villa – very spacious – and I was able to start unpacking.   Unfortunately the power went off again for a while but eventually came on again.  Unfortunately, my first night was a sleepless night due to the ‘banging’ sound of the air conditioning unit in the bathroom.   

The bedroom was very comfortable and beautifully clean.   The bathroom area was massive and there was plenty of cupboard space.  The outdoor kitchen and dining area was nice and the pool and garden also lovely.   One addition to the lounge area that I would have really enjoyed would be sun loungers.   The chairs and sofa are fine for sitting, but not for ‘lounging’ after a swim.   I really loved having the filtered water (hot and cold) on tap – that is a real luxury!

As far as the villa itself went, I had quite a few issues during my stay – some were sorted out and some not.   My phone didn’t work and had to be replaced, the safe broke and had to be replaced, both water spouts at the bathroom basins were loose and wobbled all over the place.  I asked if these could be cemented in and they were, however, were loose again the following day.   The kitchen sink had a bad smell and the water temperature at the kitchen sink was way too hot.  I couldn’t work out how to cool the water.    

Mosquito coils were definitely needed both inside and outside the villa as the mosquitos were abundant. 

The laneway walk from the main road is not pleasant and I feel that the hotel should really create a safer situation for guests by putting in some simple lighting along the way.    I was travelling alone and being female would have appreciated feeling safer by having adequate lighting.

The Manager was kind enough to meet with me as I wanted to bring to his attention some of the issues.   I was offered compensation such as a massage, breakfast or complimentary night’s stay.   I declined these however on my last morning, asked about the possibility of a complimentary transfer to Ubud.   This was declined so I was very disappointed as this would have been something I would really have appreciated.   Needless to say, I probably wouldn’t return to Taman Mesari.
title: Spacious and comfortable

text: Tucked down a short street, but very close to the action (great location) is this stunning luxury villa hotel, with a difference. The grounds are beautiful, the reception building looks like a giant bird cage and the villa itself was so gorgeous I was gobsmacked! This hotel is such great value for the amazing facilities and surroundings. The architecture is so well planned, each villa in its own escapsulating circular wall. Lovely private pool with bubble jets that wraps around the bedroom overlooking it, in a private garden with outdoor lounge and kitchen, even a second outdoor toilet. All to high standards. Then theres that bathroom! Breathtaking! circular stone wall wraps around with a double vanity, and a huge circular stone bath - looking out to a private glass encased garden!!! Seriously, could you ask for more? At this price, absolutely not. I research the pants off everything, and I looked, and I looked and I kept coming back to this place, thinking, surely not it cant be this good - theres nothing else out there like it. If you want total luxury, you will be paying a fortune, but even then, it wont look like this. The staff were just amazing too, really lovely. Most days I say the staff having a meeting with managers, for a catch up. Their level of care and attention was excellent. I could not have asked for more, and they well exceeded my expectations. Had one or two minor glitches with hot water and a power outage, but nothing concerning whatsoever. I highly recommend staying here, especially if you like a good bath!!!
title: Simply stunning!!!!!

text:
My husband and I stayed for 7 nights at Taman Mesari and once settled in we enjoyed the most relaxing holiday ever !  

Our villa was beautiful..so well planned.. clean.. spacious.. and very comfortable !  We just like to relax by the pool during the day and adventure out a night and the lovely curved infinity pool was perfect and the double Jacuzzis ideal for our purpose ! 
The floating bean bags were great to sunbake on too followed by a relaxing read in the outdoor area.

The outdoor area boasts comfy furniture.. a music box for your iPhone etc which was great.. a 19 litre filtered hot and cold water machine... a blessing as opposed to carrying heavy bottles of water home from the shops !

The location is wonderful too.. off the main hub-bub road so a nice quiet area to relax but also in the heart of things for easy access to shopping and eating.

Our only little tips would be.... please please install telephones inside the Villas too as it is very inconvenient to have to run outside to answer the phone and please please hire your new Chef asap as many holidaymakers do expect Room Service as a norm.
All in all we loved our stay there and hope to return again sometime in the future....

Well done Taman Mesari !!

text:
My partner and I stayed here for a week over New Years. The staff were very welcoming and friendly. The villa was everything to be expected - spacious, clean and modern. We slept well each night in the nice and comfortable beds. There are only 3 things that need to be improved to make it a 5 star villa. 
1) There were way too many creepy crawlies - lizards, frogs, baby spiders and millipedes making their way inside the villa. I recommend that all doors and cracks be sealed to stop them coming in!
2) The pool was nice but night time swimming was a turn off because it was too dark. It would be great to have pool lights! ALSO there was no where to sun bake, so sun beds would be a great investment too. 
3) Finally, the breakfast is quite poor and expensive compared to what you can get 50 metres outside on the street. 

Overall, we honestly enjoyed our stay here. It was a nice home away from home, and it made Bali a pleasurable holiday for us. With the listed improvements we would definitely come again!
title: Beautiful but not quite luxury

text:
We stayed at Taman Mesari Villas in June. This was a perfect holiday. The staff were great and the villa was clean and tidy everyday.  Bed was really comfortable and TV is big and new. So one can just stick a USB with your favorite shows or movies and watch it while lying on a bed. The Villa is good planed, with lovely bathroom and open kitchen in the garden. We didn't cook anything there though, but it still looks really cool. Pool has two whirlpool sitting armchair-like zones especially for couples who love to take a moment to relax and enjoy the closeness.
 
We didn't order breakfast, so I can't comment on how good or bad it was :) We like going out.  

The local facilities are great especially the local beaches, but I would recommend to hire a car, because it's a quite a distance to go anywhere by foot. As we came to Bali for surfing (no wonder) we spend all time on the beach exploring local surf spots in the area. But after salty days what a pleasure to relax in the pool and have a drink. Moreover they have a lamp-decorated  boombox in the closed garden so we enjoyed nice DJ mixes via my smartphone. 

Villa laundry service is ok, very cheap, but not fast. 

Food and nightlife are located mostly @Kuta, but the 66 Beach is also a choice for those who are looking for quite romantic sunset evening on the beach. 

Beware of ants :)These little monsters are all over the garden, they ate all our sugar, so put everything in the fridge. Especially sweets. 

Hope U like my review! Have a nice and relaxing holidays!
title: Luxury hollidays in Bali

text: The professional photos are basically what We've encounter when we enter the villa. It is that beautiful - especially the bedrooms and the bathroom of the master bedroom. Very clean, the utilities are complete, they even have dispenser, speaker ipod, hair dryer, everything. My only concern is when we arrived the master bedroom lock is not working so we cannot lock the door, thats why we need to move room thank God it's not fully booked that day - another concern would be sometimes the hot water is not working, the villa must improve this as well. My only suggestion is I think it would be nice to have the second room double bed as well - I was lucky enough to get the only 2 bedroom villa there that has both double beds. I think it would be great if you also put the double beds in other villas as opposed to single beds, just saying. So if couples are going both couples are happy. Also I think it would be better if you put a little more lights in the pool area. Other than that there is really nothing to worry about - the villas are clean, bed is clean and VERY very comfortable, air-con is cool, the room design is top notch, I really love it. The price is worth it. Would definitely be back here the next time I'm in Bali.
title: A really really enjoyable villa.

text:
My partner and I got to Bali on the 7th of June and stayed at another location in which was disgusting and putrid. We spent our first night looking at other locations to stay, we stumbled across Taman Mesari. The price was ideal in comparison to other villas and looked great online. On their website check in is at 2pm. But we ended up getting there at about 10 am in which we were welcomed with drinks and about 30 minutes later we were allowed into our private villa, in which they didn't have to do but they did. When my partner and I walked in our first thought was WOW. the place was amazing, so spacious outside.. And just the right size inside. - Bedroom was so beautiful, placed right in front of the pool alongside a separate patio area. Bed was big and super comfortable. - Great wardrobe space for all of our items. Safe is included. - Bathroom was gorgeous and very specious shower. Two basins (GREAT). The view in the bathroom was so amazing, it was all open glass with lots of greenery, which was relaxing. - Toilet was standard but spacious and clean. - Outdoor kitchen was great, had a big fridge, cooking appliances etc.. - Outdoor seating was massive and a great speaker system provided. - Towels changed everyday, bed made and place cleaned up. They would do this once you've left the villa which is very nice. They do not disturb you at all. - Breakfast is brought to you in your villa (if you specify). - Staff were amazing, they arranged our taxis at very cheap costs. And also airport transfer. - Two minute walk to the markets/AMAZING boutiques and restaurants, but still far away enough from noise and chaos.

Nothing Could've been better. I highly recommend Taman Mesari if you want to stay in luxury at an affordable price. Location is great, only a few minutes drive from Kuta, Legian and about 15-20 min (depending on traffic) from Nusa Dua. Staff were so sweet and professional. Highly recommend this place! Will definitely be back !
title: Amazing

text: I've seen some bad places but this is beyond a joke. Firstly the smell mothballs as soon as we entered stung our nostrils and dirt, grime and mold everywhere was partly to blame. The fridge smelt like dead rats or something decaying which made us all uncomfortable. The room itself looked like something you'd see if you hadn't cleaned for 10 years plus, cob webs, mold, dust and even blood stains on the curtains. The pool was a disaster also was green with mold and could not see the bottom from how dirty the pool was. Rips in the sheets and the beds were horrible. Honestly we would have a better time sleeping on the street. The price they charge per room is absurd, even half the price still not remotely worth it. There was a construction site joined to our room which look directly into our room and bathroom which meant ZERO PRIVACY and power tools were going from 7 till 7 everyday. WE HATE THIS PLACE IT SHOULD BE SHUT DOWN. THE GOOD REVIEWS ARE FAKE. DO NOT STAY HERE
title: Worst place I've ever seen

Location was great.  Just off the main Seminyak road.  The beach a 20 minute walk.  Wine shop 10 minutes away.
Sadly Bali is very quiet due to covid so sadly a lot of places closed.  
All staff at Taman Mesari were friendly, helpful and very professional.  We will be back

The initial thought is Wow! When you first walk in the villa looks spacious and modern and amazing. Once you actually look though, it’s dated, has not been maintained, not cleaned properly and not worth the money we paid.
The floors in the main bedroom had liquid spills, both bathrooms weren’t cleaned properly, the kitchen smelled so strongly of something (moth ball repellent??) it made you gag. The sliding doors in the bedrooms stuck. Easy things to fix for a ‘luxury’ villa.
There was no mini bar or in room / villa provisions (which I found unusual).
You have to order breakfast the night before which I didn’t like. The servings were small and the food not great. 
The staff are lovely but don’t speak very good English, which I don’t expect in an Indonesian country, but I do expect in a ‘luxury villa’.
Overall, the stay was extremely underwhelming. Seminyak has some amazing villas on offer and I suggest you spend your hard earned money somewhere else.

text: Wifi doesnt work 50% of the time. Place is slightly run down. Laundry is chargeable, pretty cheap. I wouldnt say the place is clean, its just bearable. Location not the best. Walk about 5mins to the main road. Very packed area. Not ideal for family. More for party folks. Breakfast is barely edible. Uber or grab pickup is messy and hard, google maps lead them via a no through road. Requires more a lot of planning and coordination to get your Uber or grab. Not really worth the money in my opinion. Better deals out there. During our stay we encountered a fair amount of bugs too though some may say thats to be expected. If its about 20% cheaper i would say its reasonable. And the word luxury is a gimmick

text:
Villas are very run down and lack maintenance. I understand that Indonesia isn’t a developed country and the same levels of cleanliness is hard to achieve as western countries, however basic cleaning and maintenance would of kept the rooms in better condition. I have stayed in many villas in Bali which far exceed Taman mesari. 

Somethings include, Blood splatter on the the bed side table. Tiles with some unknown staining on them and a pool so green you wouldn’t risk putting your head under. (See photos). No bottled water provided only a water cooler (which I suspect is filled up from a tap anyway). The shower had such poor pressure and went everywhere but straight down it was hard to get wet underneath the outlet.

 The location is good very close to Seminyak shopping and good central location. 

Would not return, there are better options out there.
title: Average at best!

text:
A nights accommodation in Bali can range from A$7.00 for a Backpacker Bed to over A$2000.00 + for a top of the range hotel, it all depends on what you want and how much you are prepared to pay.

As we had never been to Bali (we are 68 and 64 years old) we had no idea on what to expect in the way of accommodation nor pricing so I did a bit of research to try and find something that would suit our lifestyle and finances.  In the end we decided that we would book a Villa with a pool in Seminyak and started looking for just the right place, luckily we found Taman Mesari Luxury Villas - Seminyak located on Jl. Raya Seminyak, Gang Taman Sari no. 8, Seminyak 80361, Indonesia.  We could have chosen a more expensive Villa but decided on this one because if we didn't like Bali or the Villa we could cut our losses and either move to another location or come home.

We booked for six nights which included daily breakfast's and airport transfers both ways.  On arriving at Bali there was a driver waiting for us who took care of us and drove us to the Villa complex. On arriving in Seminyak we were some what concerned when the driver turned down a miserable looking alley way which did nothing to foster a good feeling.

Arriving at the Villa complex we were glad to see that it at least looked nice from the outside.  We were met by a lovely young lady (Wisma) who knew our names and offered us a cold towel and cool drink (it was 1:00 pm after all).  After completing the necessary paperwork we were shown to our Villa (8A) and to say that we were impressed would have to be an understatement!

The Villa was huge!  It had an outdoor kitchen / lounge area, grassed area, jacuzzi and pool, all of this before you even opened the door to the actual Villa itself.  Once inside there was a huge bedroom with a king size bed and flat screen TV,  a massive bathroom with a rain shower and large circular bath tub, twin vanity sinks and plenty of storage.  All in all it was a very good choice, well at least for us anyway.

During our stay we found the staff all to be very friendly and helpful, willing to go out of their way to make sure that we were looked after.  We even met the Managing Partner, Mr I Putu Sukadana who was also very friendly and wanted to know what we thought of the Villa's and how they could be improved.  I have even taken the liberty of writing to him privately to thank him for their hospitality and a few ideas on how to increase his client demographic (I have an MBA in Business Development and International Marketing).

Yes there are more expensive Villas in Bali that may have that little bit extra but if you are looking for a reasonably priced Villa, that has everything going for it then you cannot go past the Taman Mesari Luxury Villas in Seminyak.  Yes we will be going back to enjoy their hospitality again.
title: An Oasis

text: A nice little villa hotel with very friendly staff and they really so everything to help you with whatever you ask them! We only stayed for 3 nights and had a good time in Bali. I need to say that the hotel is okay but maybe in need of some renovations and should be better cleaned since I found for example the fridge very dirty and not cleaned for some time. The pool was nice but not really cleaned and since they have lots of plants and trees in the area the leaves and stuff falls in the pool. The bedsheets looked maybe not so clean but smelled good so I think just old and maybe need to be changed. The villas ar big and you will have enough room for 2 people in the one bedroom villa. Outdoor kitchen is nothing we used in our 3 days since me  my gf like to eat out. Breakfast was nice considering it's included and you can also choose what time which is a +. The pictures are a little misleading since they probably are a few years old, it's more torn down then u the pictures. What I could say is that you get a lot for your money in a hideaway place but still close to much shopping, bars and restaurants! Don't know if I would stay again and that's more because i like to change it up when revisiting a destination until I find my favourite spot. They get a 4 for such amazing service and hospitality!! Thanks Taman mesari!!
title: Amazing staff

text:
I enjoyed my stay here! I went with 2 other friends and we got the 2 bedroom villa w/ private pool. It's a great place to relax with an outdoor table and seating area that's covered in case it rains + a small private pool. I recommend staying here if you're traveling with 3+ people as it's good value for the money (as opposed to having to get 2 hotel rooms elsewhere).

The breakfast was complimentary and pretty good. You have various options to choose from and the staff brings it to you in the AM. You just tell them the time and they ring the bell and set up the breakfast inside the villa.

The decor was nice. Very earthy with nice touches such as outdoor showers, little garden in the bathroom. The rooms are spacious. Each room had a bathroom w/ a shower, big tub & double sinks.

The staff were friendly and accommodating.
title: Great villa! Spacious, great decor & friendly staff

text:
We loved every moment of our stay at Taman Mesari Villas.  Mesari is really a boutique set of 10 unit villas, five of which are 2 bedroom while the others are 1 bedroom. All villas have their own private pool and we can connect the villa and make it as three bedroom.
We found the staff to be very professional and friendly. Special mentions go to  Wisma in Reception and Kadek Kusuma in housekeeping who consistently went out of their way to help. Housekeeping do a very thorough job.
The Manager, Putu has done a great job of training the staff.
The villas themselves are very good and are quiet. You certainly have your privacy.
The pool was really good although they aren't the easiest to get into or out of.
It is only a 5 minute drive to the main restaurant and shopping areas of Seminyak 
It is a 5 minute walk to Bintang Supermarket or to Grain restaurant.
Taman Mesari Villas is conveniently located.
We had a Groupon and found it to be great value. The massages were great and the food was really good, especially the pasta dishes. 
We loved our time at Mesari and we definitely back soon!!!

text:
We stayed at the Taman Mesari for  7 days in mid September. This was an amazing experience and would like to thank every single staff member for making it so memorable. I have been working in the travel industry for 20 years and taman mesari is up there with my top travel experiences. 
We stayed in Villa 5B which is a 2 bedroom villa. It was unbelievable! Over 212m2 in size with 2 stunning rooms that are not joined to provide extra privacy. The bathrooms were amazing particularly the master. It was like a small apartment!
I was a little nervous as you think that all the great reviews may be a little hyped up but rest assured folks this is the real deal and you wont be disappointed. 
Breakfast daily served for you and the food was so yummy! Easy to order from local restaurants like room service.and of course all the wonderful restaurants in Seminyak so close by. 
Lastly the staff are all so very friendly and nothing was a problem for them. Thank you Mr Putu for all your assistance and you must be commended for leading such an amazing team. Everyone we encountered at Taman Mesari were amazing. Our 5 year old daughter was treated like a princess! Thanks to Mr Hery for all his help and assistance.Again all staff were amazing.
The best thing about Taman Mesari was you could spend the day enjoying your pool, relaxing and then go into town for a meal or just a wander around.We cant wait to come back with friends to enjoy this wonderful slice of heaven.We plan on doing that soon!
Do yourself a favour and book Taman Mesari you wont regret it.

text:
Where to start?! Everything about Taman Mesari was absolutely magical. We had the most incredible stay here. 

When we first arrived the charming security guard welcomed us and showed us in where we met by the wonderful lady behind reception who gave us a cold towel and delicious welcome drink. 

We were driven about 1 hour from the airport. As soon as the entrance door was opened, our jaws dropped. We were blown away by the sheer size of our own private villa. We weren't expecting a villa so big, a pool so big, a garden so big! 

Taman Mesari is very modern and as a result everything is so clean. Everything was impeccable.

The bed was the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in. The bathroom was beautiful with fresh towels constantly. The complimentary toiletries that they give you are all lovely. 

The service was outstanding. For breakfast, they will serve it in your own villa. You get a selection of fruits, bread, juice and tea anyway, but on top of that you can choose a dish from their daily menu. Between us we had eggs Benedict, French toast, an omelette and waffles. Everything was exceptional and such a treat to have it all made in front of you. 

What is nice about Taman Mesari is that their prices are really reasonable. Unlike other five star hotels who try to charge a fortune for food and spa treatments, everything at Taman Mesari, from massages to lunch, was better priced than a lot of places in town. Sadly we didn't get to try their  restaurant, but if it's anything like their breakfast and lunch, I'm sure it's sensational! 

The service is second to none. Everyone is incredibly welcoming, kind and sincere. They go above and beyond to make sure everything is perfect. 

It's a 5 minute walk from restaurants and shops, but it feels like you're completely secluded. We had the best time at Taman Mesari and we can't recommend it enough. Our stay was absolutely faultless and we can't thank the staff enough for everything they did for us. We will return one day for a much longer stay :)

text:
My wife and I stayed here for our Honeymoon for 5 nights. We chose Taman Mesari based on previous reviews and we could not have been more pleased. They picked us up from the airport at 01:45am when we arrived. The privacy is A1 as you get to choose what time they arrive for breakfast, the time they service your room and what time you'd like tea time in the afternoon. 

We used the spa services for massages which were all amazing! We also needed to rent a car/driver to drive us to Ubud (1.5 hrs away) which they arranged. 

The driver was very professional and helpful during the day and took excellent care of us. We also used room service to order food which they came in and set up for us once it arrived. Taman Mesari staff went above and beyond our needs and expectations and we can't thank them enough! 

The experience was much better than staying at an overpriced and overcrowded brand resort. Taman Mesari gives you the privacy, attention and luxury you deserve while being close enough to visit the beach clubs and other fun places nearby. The villa itself is a short walk from Double Six Beach, Cocoon Bar, and restaurants and shopping which was pretty convenient.

Came to Bali to celebrate our 22nd wedding anniversary with my wife & 2 daughters in Two Bedroom Villa with Waterfall. We were BLOWN away by this place! 
We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa (villa 5B) which has a huge master bedroom and bathroom & walk in closet and 2 other spacious bedrooms/bathrooms. We have our own private pool, kitchen and a large sitting area. The whole place is very private and squeaky clean & the staff is very attentive, courteous, very helpful & professional. They provide free airport transport for us.
Breakfast is provided & at least 2 staff will prepare your food in your very own kitchen while you wait. 
They do provide in room dining & restaurants
My whole family loves this place & we're already seriously talking about coming back next year. I definitely would recommend this place to everyone! Terimakasih!!!

text:
We stayed at Mesari  in a 2 bedroom villa for 6 nights, travelling with 2 teenagers meant the extra space was perfect for us all.
The villa are located at the back of the hotel and are nice and quiet.
The day beds on the balcony are comfortable and a nice area to relax in private.
The rooms are clean and having a full sized fridge in the kitchen was handy when stocking up with supplies from Bintang Supermarket which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel.
The pool area is clean and refreshing, plenty of shade but also sunny areas if you want to work on your tan. Day bed that they provide near the pool are comfortable and a nice way to spend a few hours unwinding after shopping/exploring the busy streets of Seminyak/Legian. 
Its only a 10 minute walk to the beach to watch the sunset and enjoy a meal. 
The hotel staff are so friendly and helpful, always smiling and greeting you when you see them. We tried the breakfast in both the restaurant and at the villa and they both have a good variety of asian and western selections. 
The waffle/pancake  was a hit with our son each morning and the pizzas you can order from room service where great too.
We would definitely recommend Taman Mesari and would stay again.
title: Nice secenery Confortable, and suitable. for family holidays

text:
I said to travel agent, I want to get away without the kid, without the laptop and blackberry and reconnect with my wife again. It was our fourth wedding anniversary, it had to be Bali as wife had already booked the flyer tickets.
Well, this place was just perfect-the villa's were spacious verging on huge, luxuriously appointed, everything was well and peaceful stay. Private poos was cherry on the top.

The staff always smiled and said yes to every request, so much co that I often did not know if the request was even understood, but sure enough, they came through with everything we requested-nothing was too much trouble for them,

Free massage was included and wife thoroughly enjoyed all spa treatments she had. 
As to my ratings:
I gave it 5 for value, as we got great value as it hit all the spots, but it is not cheap.
I give 4 for location as its not on the beach, but it is only a 10 minutes walk to the beach.
This was a real treat for the 2 of us and is highly recommended.
title: spacious, excellent service

text: We stayed for 12 nights at taman mesari in june 2017 and were super impressed by 1) the luxuriousness of the villa's themselves and 2) more so the service that you get from the staff there. From start to finish we could not have asked for anything more.. taman mesari team led by Mr Putu were at our beck and call 24-7 and they thought of every little detail to make our stay with no doubt the best holiday we have ever had. We stayed in Villa 4B which was in a lovely quiet spot on the complex, we had complete privacy and the villa has everything you need and more to make for an unbelievable stay. We had our lovely breakfast served in the villa every morning and one night i arranged for a romantic dinner to be prepared in our villa, which was amazing! the team came in and transformed our villa into a romantic paradise, candles and flower arrangements floating on our pool and much more! These are effectively serviced villa's i.e its not a resort as you would imagine..but its better as you literally have 24 hour service and whatever you need, they will get for you... including a wide range of take away foods from local restaurants (i.e proper restaurants not McD's or BK!). The team at taman mesari find just the right balance to service your every need whilst giving you that privacy that you ultimately are paying for. We even got invited to the 1th birthday party of taman mesari whilst we were there where you could see how great a family atmosphere the staff have created. If we ever go back to Bali there is only 1 place we will stay and i would recommend Taman Mesari to anyone considering a private villa booking in Bali. It is in the up market area of Seminyak that is undergoing some major development, but not anything that impacts your stay. Book now and dont be disappointed!  Mr Putu is a legend! :-)
title: Awesome

text:
My wife and I stayed at this villa  for four nights from New Years Eve 2016. We wanted to stay somewhere exclusive, private and very luxurious.
Well, this villa  was a stand out! The villas are gorgeous! Massive open air living areas, gorgeous bedroom, bathroom and the pool and grounds are fabulous.
Some people may not like that the living areas and bathroom are "open air" and so are whatever the temperature is outside but personally I liked it. It made me remember that I was on a tropical island and also appreciate just how good the air conditioning in the Bedroom was. The large open living area does have two ceiling fans made though which made the living area very comfortable. And if you do get hot, go for a swim in your private pool, completely nude, no one can see you over the 3m+ high rendered walls!
Every morning someone would come and serve us breakfast in our own villa at a time we requested and we also arranged for two masseurs to give us private massages in the grounds of our private villa.
title: GREAT AND LOVELY STAY!

text:
Wonderful, modern, unique, luxurious, first class Villas.
From the friendly, personalised service form arrival to departure (always with a smile, no matter the time day or night), to the A+ in villa chef and the immaculate villas.
 It was a truly incredible stay.  I haven't got the words to explain how happy I am to have stayed here from the many choices available - I did a lot of research and I am so pleased I chose Taman Villas. 
Walking distance to a plethora of bars and restaurants and 10 minutes walk (with shopping stops) to the beach. 
I cant understand where people would have any complaints. 6 nights of heaven! I will return, no question about it.
title: Wonderful, modern, unique, luxurious, first class Villas

text: I loved this place - it's set back from the main road so it's perfectly tranquil, away from the bustle of Seminyak. The only sound comes from the waterfall into the private pool. The layout of the villa enhances the outdoors and is surrounded by lush greenery. It's a small, boutique establishment so you rarely see or hear other guests. Staff were very friendly and attended to our needs quickly. It's very handy having breakfast delivered to your villa, but order for 15 min before you want it because it will be late! We got a couples massage and a 4 course private dinner included in our room and both were fantastic. Awesome having 15L water coolers provided too, so we could cut down on plastic waste. The faults pointed out in previous reviews are fair, but overall our stay was very positive.
title: Private oasis

I love the villa and all,theres a speaker so u can just plug your phone and pump some music! Overall awesome!

Le taman mesari a tout pour être un produit de grande qualité.  Hélas  ! cet établissement ne mérite pas ses 5 étoiles 

L'emplacement est remarquable et lorsque  l'on rentre dans la villa , tout paraît très beau , la piscine privée devant la chambre , la véranda comportant un salon de jardin et une kitchenette , une douche extérieure , mais en fait tout est très mal entretenu , par exemple le sol de la véranda est sale , les vitres de la chambre non faites, les robinetteries desserrées.....

Le jardin de la villa est néanmoins joli et bien entretenu . 

Le petit déjeuner n'est pas bon . Dans un pays qui regorge de fruits , il ne nous est même pas servi de jus de fruits frais . Les viennoiseries ne sont pas fraîches à tel point que nous avons préféré prendre notre petit déjeuner à l'extérieur . 
La plus grosse déception est la réaction d'un employé lorsqu'il a remarqué que nous avions cassé un verre de la kitchenette , Il nous a demandé de le payer . Cette demande provenant d'un établissement qui se nomme ' ' ´ Luxury villa ' nous a paru exagérée . Face à notre refus , par principe , le verre étant très ordinaire , type verre à moutarde , il nous a indiqué que si nous ne le payons pas , ce serait à lui de le faire !!!!Nous avons trouvé que ce chantage était insupportable ! Nous en avons référé au manager qui n'a rien rétorqué. 
 
Vraiment dommage !

text:
Nous avons été très déçus par cet Hôtel décrit comme un hôtel 5 étoiles sur Internet, avec des avis en général positif. 
Nous avons décidé de réserver pour y séjourner 4 nuits.
À notre arrivé au « Lobby » l’accueil était chaleureux, malheureusement le desk et la table basse d’entrée très sale (cendre de cigarette, un avant goût de la propreté de la chambre).
Après 20 minutes d’attente le réceptionniste nous mènes à notre chambre et la, une avalanche de mauvaises surprises. 
Pour commencer nous arrivons dans notre salon ouvert, un bel espace comme sur les photos, plutôt agréable néanmoins les housses de sofa extérieur n’ont pas étaient lavées depuis un bon moment ( taches noires sur les coussins, cendres, poussières ), nous ne prêtons pas attention car cela reste un salon extérieur donc la poussière est classique. 
Ensuite un petit escalier nous mène à l’entrée de notre chambre. 
Que dire sur la saleté de cet endroit , des traces sur le miroir et les murs ou la peinture défraîchie s’écaille et tombe, pour rajouter à ça les draps sales (présence de nombreuses taches jaunes et noires, cheveux sur l’oreiller) sans parler du sol collant, taches de café et traces de pieds !! 
Les serviettes de bain et l’état de la douche ne valait pas mieux...
En sachant que 2 semaines avant j’ai appelé l’hôtel et envoyé un mail de confirmation en demandant gentillement de faire une petite surprise à mon fiancé pour notre voyage d’engagement. (quelques fleurs pour rigoler) 
Pas de réponse concrète de leur part. 
Nous avons demandé à rencontrer le MANAGER afin de lui exposer notre souhait de partir très vite de cet endroit. 
Il a était compréhensif et désireux de connaître les raisons de notre départ, nous l’avons donc inviter à prendre connaissance des problèmes rencontre sur le lieu, accompagné de son assistant qui prenait en photo chaque réclamation. 
Au vue des problèmes rencontré il a décider et trouver normal de nous rembourser la totalité du séjour que nous aurions dû passer là-bas, alors que nous lui avons rien réclamé.
L’équipe reste tout de même chaleureuse et accueillante. Tous cela n’empêche pas que l’endroit reste très beau mais un sérieux coup de rafraîchissement serait le bienvenue. 
Pour le prix il y a bien mieux à Seminyak et bien plus propre ( certe le prix n’est pas excessif mais la propreté dans tout type d’herbgement touristique reste primordial)
Le staff reste tout de même très sympathique et très profesionnel! J’espère pour cet hôtel qu’il feront le nécessaire pour satisfaire leur clientèle. Je leur souhaite...
title: Deçue...

text:
Quel tristesse que des hôtels soit capables d'une si piètre prestation à Bali. Que ce soit l'état de vétusté du mobilier, la qualité incommensurablement médiocre de la nourriture. Ou le manque d'initiative, de réaction, de connaissance des codes du Luxe de l'ensemble du staff (direction comprise), la saleté de l'ensemble des installations et du linge mise à disposition dans la Villas ou encore la configuration des lieux rendant la piscine inutilisable du fait d'un manque d'exposition au soleil. Sans oublier le prix honteusement élevé d'une si pitoyable prestation. 

Il est donc certain que cet hôtel ne mérite aucunement ses 5 étoiles. La réalité des choses menant plutôt cet hôtel aux alentours du deux étoiles. Sans plaisanter, malheureusement! 

Nous avions donc réserver pour 7 jours et sommes parties au bout de 3,  après une âpre négociation avec un staff aucunement qualifié, dépassé et livré à lui même. 

La note de cette hôtel s'approchant des 8 sur booking relève tout simplement du miracle ou de l'escroquerie digitale. 

Le seul point positif de cet établissement étant effectivement sont emplacement. Cependant celui ci ne suffira certainement pas à vous faire oublier le marasme régnant dans la villa. 

Booking devrait peut être penser à vérifier la qualité et la pertinence de la notation de ces partenaires commerciaux. 

Car il s'agit belle bien d'une minable escroquerie en bande organisé . 

Cette hôtel est donc à bannir de votre recherche de bien être à Bali. 

#tristesse #escroc #pitoyable #cethotelvafermer #passetonchemin
title: Escroquerie en bande organisé

text: Wurden aufgrund eines Buchungsfehler von unserem ursprünglichen Hotel in das Taman Mesari umgebucht. Und es war super, hätten es uns nicht besser vorstellen können. Die Villen sind einfach traumhaft und sehr groß, jeden Tag bekamen wir frische Hand und Badetücher die sehr angenehm nach Seife rochen. Das Personal war sehr nett und immer sehr hilfsbereit und zuvorkommend. Man kann sie auch immer nach Tipps fragen. Das Frühstück wurde täglich zur gewünschten Zeit  in die Villa serviert. Es war ein sehr angenehmer und schöner Aufenthalt. Können es nur jedem weiterempfehlen.
title: Super Aufenthalt !!!
